General Rules at Service Check.title: Tightening Torque Rules for NM48/750 KW
Lubrication Rules and General check for NM48/750 KW

Safety Rules.title: Turbine should be stopped, activate “SERVICE KEY” before start to climb
Safety Belt with double anchoring lanyard, Safety Helmet and safety shoes must wear
Alert by sound / vibration to flora-fauna, reptile etc. Ensure tower light glowing at every platform
Before taking position to tower climb at bottom platform, should be too careful on standing in ladder support clamp
Ensure activeness of Repos switch working condition at 1st Shell platform
After passing every tower platform, platform door must keep in closed condition
Lanyard must lock at every tower shell platform and lanyard must lock at top platform before separating fall arrester, check ladder supporting clamp bolts, ladder bolt’s tightness at every platform
Top platform door opening shall be risk at few cases due to power cable excess loose. If unable to open, make yawing and open top platform door.
Yawing automatic fuse at control panel to be opened before start of maintenance and other activity
Disc lock must be in activation and blade should be “Y” Shape before entering into hub. An engineer must enter into hub with help of hub entry safety device

Before opening of Nacelle top door, ensure healthiness of nacelle top door damper, if door damper not in healthiness or failure, should be too vigilance and make appropriate precaution to be made for open of top door mode.
While working in gear oil pump motor area, brake caliper and its accessories, hazards will be over head, be caution!

While nacelle door in open mode, top door lock will be possible to hit on head or shoulder. To be in safe while working in main bearing luber, service hoist operation, oil cooler radiator, generator terminal, vibration sensor etc.
Ensure service hoist working area properly locked and healthiness of its accessories
When opening hub door, ensure wind speed and keep hub door in safe place
First Aid box should be at nacelle time of working

Fall Protection System.title: Check Condition of anchor point for safety rope in every tower plat form.
Check condition of safety rope, Shackles and shackle lock.
Check tightness of every ladder joining bolts
Check visual condition of life line rope and it’s appearance, loose-fit etc..

Tower.title: Check Concrete surface cracks at the transition between concrete and the embedded Ring
Inspect welding condition at entrance; inspect holes and flanges
Torque 250 NM bottom flange at embedded
Torque 250 – M16 Middle flange of the tower
Torque 480 NM bolts for Nacelle/Tower Assembly
Check paint condition on Tower Shell
Check visual condition of all platform bolt joints & platform plywood condition
Check condition of all cables running at all shells & platforms
Check Tower shell lights working condition and damage free
Lubricate tower door hinges, Mobilith SHC 460 as required

Braking System.title: Open brake disc fibre enclosure (Dog House) and inspect brake disc, check dog cover for no damage
Check tightness of bolts of brake disc coupled with high speed shaft flange - Torque 100 NM
Check brake disc thickness & lining marks (Brake disc thickness should not be below 26 MM)
Check brake pad thickness (Should be 4.0 MM) at both side (if uneven wear, note in remarks) (New pad : 12.00 MM, pad should be between 4 - 12 MM Thickness)
Check caliper alignment, if uneven pad wear. (Uneven wear difference in pads is allowed to have tolerance of 1 or 2 MM Only)
Check tightness of M20*60 MM brake caliper bracket bolts in Gear box - Torque 310 NM
Check tightness of M20*90 MM brake caliper bolts in brackets - Torque 310 NM
Check for no oil leakage from caliper & it's hose
Check start pressure switch settings: 56+2 Bar
Check alarm pressure switch Settings : 50+2 Bar
Inspect the oil filter, replace wherever applicable
Replace suction filter in hydraulic unit, must replace
Check pressure in hydraulic unit at the time of mechanical brake activeness
Check the test of brake worn and brake hot
Check for no cables loose in plugs for hydraulic motor, pump, Hydraulics valves
Check oil Level of hydraulic unit

Coupling.title: Check tightness of M20*150 MM of all arm bolts at Brake disc flange - Torque 400 NM
Check tightness of M20*120 MM of all arm bolts at generator flange - Torque 400 NM
CCheck tightness of M20*85 MM of all bolts in Coupling tube at both side - Torque 400 NM
Check arm rubber healthiness, how many Numbers?
Check for coupling arm rubber damages are severe, the length of generator has to be measured

Gearbox.title: Check Oil Level & for no Leakage
Check condition of all hoses fittings & crimping for no leakage
Check brake disc thickness & lining marks (Brake disc thickness should not be below 26 MM)
Check brake pad thickness (Should be 4.0 MM) at both side (if uneven wear, note in remarks) (New pad : 12.00 MM, pad should be between 4 - 12 MM Thickness)
Check caliper alignment, if uneven pad wear. (Uneven wear difference in pads is allowed to have tolerance of 1 or 2 MM Only)
Check tightness of M20*60 MM brake caliper bracket bolts in Gear box - Torque 310 NM
Check tightness of M20*90 MM brake caliper bolts in brackets - Torque 310 NM
Check for no oil leakage from caliper & it's hose
Check start pressure switch settings: 56+2 Bar
Check alarm pressure switch Settings : 50+2 Bar
Inspect the oil filter, replace wherever applicable
Replace suction filter in hydraulic unit, must replace

Main Shaft & Bearing Housing.title: Check main shaft surface for no damage
Check tightness of M30*320 MM rotor bolts
Check tightness of M24*140 MM main bearing housing bolts
Check condition of main bearing dust seals
Check main bearing end cover bolts tightness, for no grease leakages
Check grease level in reservoirs, fill it
Check reservoirs pump working condition and Ensure grease injection to bearings

Blades - Hydraulics - Hub.title: Check tightness of Rotor RPM sensor fittings and its cable
Check visual condition of Blade and blade tip, Use Binocular
Inspect hub connection for no damage on metal parts
Check for no leakages in hydraulics fittings & its hoses
Check pressure transmitter and bar settings
Check tightness of M30*470 MM blade bolts in hub
Check hub fittings rust free and damage free
Check condition of fixing bracket of the nose cone

Generator.title: Make empty of grease collecting tray of generator both bearings
Lubricate Generator drive and non-drive end bearings, lubricate each bearing.
Check tightness of M20*240 MM generator mount bolts
Check tightness M24*110 MM Generator mount base frame bolts
Check condition of generator cable’s and lugs at terminal and ensure tightness at generator terminal
Check tightness of Generator RPM sensor fitting’s and its cables
Clean dust formed on generator RPM sensor and RPM pick up plates
Check Condition of Vibration damper, bearing and rubber mat

Water Cooling System.title: Check Condition of radiator, its hoses for no leakage including dust blocks condition in cooling fins
Check water pump coolant for no leakage
Check for no leakage in coolant hose
Test pH value of coolant level ≥ 7.5
Check water cooler pump Working Condition
Check condition of Coolant Hose damage free and visual condition at nacelle outside

Yaw System.title: Check yaw ring internal gearing for no damage
Check clearance between tooth rim and internal gearing. Clearance should be between 0.2 - 0.4 MM
Check for no oil leakage in yaw gear
Check yaw tooth rim for no cracks
Check tightness of M14*50 MM yaw gear base frame
Check tightness of yaw bearing ring with tower flange
Check tightness of claw plate to base frame
Check yaw direction and motor direction
Check counts of yaw counter at both side yawing
Lubricate lip seals of yaw system
Check tightness of yaw sensor fittings and its cable
Check tightness of Yaw Friction Brake

Nacelle Check Points.title: Check tightness of all cabinet bolt joints and cable fittings
Check tightness of bolt terminals in cabinets
Remove and insert all cables socket
Check working condition of Nacelle Lights
Check wind vane for no mechanical defect and for no loose fits
Check Anemo meter for no mechanical defect and for no loose bolts
Check availability of north position sensor
Interrupt main circuit breaker and ensure turbine gets stopped
Check position sensor with WTG set-up
Check Vibration balls sensor fittings and for no mechanical defect, activate error
Check Twist Sensor settings and release twist condition, set
Check for no damage of nacelle fibre, door fibre, nose cone fibre, radiator fibre. And, also Check condition of ll hub fibre doors

Safety Items.title: Check availability & Healthiness of fire extinguisher
Check availability of First Aid box & top-up wherever required
Check physical condition of Power panel Mat

Bottom Panel.title: Check condition of cables at all panels
Check earthing cables or flat, standard wire gauge
Check & clean bye pass contactor, Big G, Small g Kits
Check working condition of Thyristor Cooling Fan
Check working condition of Main Power Panel Cooling Fan & healthiness of dust filter condition
Check working condition of ICDS Panel Cooling Fan
Check working condition of Reactive Power Panel Cooling Fan
Check healthiness of Dhen Guard 600 FM
Check healthiness of OBO Surge arrester in ICDS panel
Check tightness of contactor bolts in EH 700, AF 780 & 800 Amps
Check tightness of contactor EH 210, AF 265
Check tightness of Capacitor’s duty contactor
Check tightness of Capacitor cables at all stages
Check tightness of Dhen guard and OBO Surge arrestor

Capacitor Bank.title: Check activeness of capacitor Banks (Reactive Power Panel/ICDS Panel)
Check activeness of capacitor ( Reactive Power Panel/ICDS Panel )
Check activeness of Contactor & fuse (Reactive Power Panel)
Check activeness of Fuse’s, MCB’s, Charging Relay & Discharging relay (ICDS Panel )

HT Yard Maintenance and Transformer.title: Check the condition of Female and Male Contactors in AB switch (EB)
Check the condition of Female and Male Contactors in AB switch (Consumer)
Check Operating condition of AB switch - apply petroleum jelly (EB)
Check Operating condition of AB switch - apply petroleum jelly (Consumer)
Check activeness of Lightning Arrestor at HT yard (EB)
Check activeness of Lightning Arrestor at HT yard (Consumer)
Check condition of all binding joints in both HT yard (EB)
Check condition of all binding joints in both HT yard (Consumer)
Check healthiness of Pin insulator, Disc Insulator and post insulator at HT yard (EB)
Check healthiness of Pin insulator, Disc Insulator and post insulator at HT yard (Consumer)
Check tightness bushing connector (CT/PT)
Check tightness bushing connector (Transformer)
Check oil level (CT/PT)
Check oil level (Transformer)
Check for no oil leakage (CT/PT)
Check for no oil leakage (LT bushing LV1)
Check for no oil leakage (LT bushing LV2)
Check for no oil leakage (Buchholz Relay)
Check for no oil leakage (Top Cover)
Check for no oil leakage (Explosive Vent)
Check for no oil leakage (Conservator Tank)
Check for no oil leakage in Cooling fins
Check Transformer breather silica gel colour appearance
Check oil availability in transformer breather oil cup
Check Cable lugs condition in LT Bushing terminal
Check tightness of neutral and its link, bushings including fasteners - Torque 70 NM
Check Earth Fault Relay activeness & Neutral CT, its tightness
Check Condition of HT Poles Coping in EB Yard
Check Condition of HT Poles Coping in Consumer Yard
Check condition of Yard Flooring
Check condition of Transformer Plinth
Check House Keeping of HT yards
Earth pit Resistance Values last Taken & Updated values in Earth pits
